descriptions.overview: IRWIN Marathon with WeldTec fiber cement blade.
list: Carbide teeth are welded not brazed
50% longer life versus original IRWIN Marathon blades

specs.title: Compatible with Tile and Cut-Off Saws

reviews.title: "Not good for Hardie"
reviews.text: I had same result as previous reviewer.  I made about 5 cuts on Hardie siding and the blade started smoking.  I put back on my Diablo that had done several (a lot - like at least a dozen) jobs and finished the job out over the next couple days with it.  I thought it might be getting a little dull - that is why I bought a new blade.  Well I found out what dull is after 5 measly cuts with this Irwin.  Lowes was good in that they let me return the blade with no hassle.  I guess Irwin does not actually specifically state that the blade is for Hardie like Freud and Dewalt do, but they do say that it is for Fiber cement, and Hardie is fiber cement.  So I don't know what the deal is.
reviews.author: Gettingtooldforthiskindofwork

reviews.title: "Over $1 per foot of cutting"
reviews.text: I purchased this blade at my local Lowes a few days ago for siding part of a small shed with some leftover Hardie fiber cement siding I had.  I was only able to finish about 16 feet worth of cuts and the blade is already completely dull and worthless.  This blade is not worth the money and Lowes should not carry such a poor product.
reviews.author: J

reviews.title: "Terrible for Hardie Siding"
reviews.text: I made one and a half cuts on the trim. Half way through the second cut it quit cutting, started throwing Sparks and smoking.
reviews.author: JOEL

reviews.title: "BAD BLADE!"
reviews.text: Made one pass on 4'x'8'x 5/16" hardie sheet material and burned and dulled blade. Blade was on a new DeWALT DWE575 that had worked great with wood blades for the last three weeks.
reviews.author: Disappointed

reviews.title: "Worst cement board blade ever"
reviews.text: This blade lasted 2 cuts on 1/2‚Äù Hardi Backer. This blade broke down faster than much cheaper blades. The teeth are thinner than the blade after 2 cuts. DON't BUY IT!!
reviews.author: D-Ray

reviews.title: "Does not last long"
reviews.text: Sorry but this blade just doesn't last more then 20 cuts or so. The teeth are gone and the blade is smoking.
reviews.author: Easy

reviews.title: "HORRIBLE, HORRIBLE, HORRIBLE"
reviews.text: Bought 2 of these because I was installing fiber cementboard siding. Each blade lasted only 3 1/2 cuts. Don't waste your time or money. Ugh!
reviews.author: gofortheheart

reviews.title: "Don't buy me!  I'm only good for 5 minutes!"
reviews.text: I didnt read the reviews before buying this blade.  Previously I had sided my home and shed with a Diablo brand, which was fantastic.  Needed to do a small project so I bought this less expensive brand.  What I didnt expect is by my 5th cut it was as effective as using a steak knife on a hardie board!  Seriously, Lowes look at all the poor reviews and stop selling it!  Save yourself the headache and buy the Diablo!  Or buy this and beat your head against the wall to finish, settling for a steak knife to get it done.
reviews.author: Anonymous

reviews.title: "Terrible quality"
reviews.text: Like many of the other reviewers, I only made 3 or 4 cuts with the blade before the teeth seemingly spontaneously combusted. There was no sign of them at all.
reviews.author: Garrett

reviews.title: "It does not work, it's garbage."
reviews.text: It is a garbage or a single cut had done when it no longer served and did not cut. that was throwing my money, for pity I did not go to deliver it to Lowes.
reviews.author: Angel

reviews.title: "Dull in less than 10 cuts"
reviews.text: My experience was unfortunately very similar to other reviews. I don't think I made more than 10 cuts on Hardiplank siding and the blade was useless. I was able to rip some 1.5‚Äù strips for my starter course and make one perpendicular cut; after that the blade was done. Hoping I can return it and get a credit towards something better. It felt unsafe to use near the end. Good news is I had an excuse to call it quits early on my DIY siding job and play with the kids.
reviews.author: Rich

reviews.title: "Lousy!  Good money down the drain...."
reviews.text: First time doing anything with fiber cement siding. Since I was going to be doing multiple rip cuts on the 4'x8' hardie board (sheet goods) I made sure to get the "right" blade. This one dulled quickly and never tracked straight. After 2 rips it was done!  I switched out to the old WELL used carbide tipped framing blade that was originally in my saw and it's still going strong after over 20 rips, and shows no sign of stopping. Wish that I still had my receipt so I could return this piece of junk....
reviews.author: Clif

reviews.title: "Blade only good for a few cuts"
reviews.text: I originally saw this as a money-saver over the higher priced blades since I was doing a small chimney. After about a dozen cuts, blade was getting very warm and even the material was hot. The blade dulled very quickly and completely stopped cutting after about 20 crosscuts on 8.25" hardie plank. I recommend you spend the extra money if you're doing anything more than replacing a couple boards.
reviews.author: GregO

reviews.title: "worthless"
reviews.text: I made less than 10 cuts and the blade was already going bad. 15-20 cuts and it was toast.  I was only cutting 1/4 hardibacker. I got to find something beyond hand tools to cut this stuff but this product isn't it!
reviews.author: diy

reviews.title: "warning dont buy"
reviews.text: I bought two of these blades and was able to make about eight cuts between both. They dulled out and started smoking. I cut hardie trim so about 40‚Äù total. Save your money there complete garbage.
reviews.author: Steve

reviews.title: "Read reviews first !!!"
reviews.text: Sadly I'm seeing the reviews after I already went through 3 blades on a small chimney siding replacement with Hardie board fiber cement planks. I saw it in Lowe's bought one then after it burned the teeth when I was 1/3 into the job (destroying several planks in the process which are also $13 each). So  I did a dumbest thing and went back and bought 2 more desperate to finish the job rather than looking for better blad. Only now after I'm looking for blade to cut bricks I saw the reviews and I wish I had spend more money on a better blade from the beginning. I'll take the 3 toothless blades back to Lowe's as someone suggested in one review and hopefully they give me credit towards better blade.
reviews.author: MR

reviews.title: "Not for Hardi plank siding"
reviews.text: Bought this blade because it was the only one that Lowe's sold for cutting any kind of cement board. Blade must be intended for cutting tile backer board and not Hardi plank siding. Only got 30 cross cuts on 8" siding before blade was trying to catch on fire. Called Lowe's tool pro and asked for different recommended blade but no help. Went to the orange store and bought a 4 tooth red blade and made over 100 cross cuts and still have life in the blade. The old saying holds true you get what you pay for.
reviews.author: Bulldog

reviews.title: "trash"
reviews.text: seriously like 2 feet of cuts and it was toast
reviews.author: Chuck

reviews.title: "Read the reviews before wasting 20 bucks"
reviews.text: I wish I had read the reviews before wasting 20 bucks on this blade. I don't know what it's made of or for but it's not for cutting fiber cement. I had a small job to do with Hardie Plank 8" lap siding, I made 3 cuts before I gave up on it. It just gets red hot and throws a lot of smoke and slowly burns it's way through making a terrible cut. It should be illegal for Irwin to advertise it as a fiber cement blade. I'm sure the three 5 star reviews are paid reviewers.
reviews.author: TW

reviews.title: "Wasted Money on Irwin"
reviews.text: Wish I would have read all these reviews before I bought. Like others I bought this Irwin cement board blade because it was the only one Lowe's had on the shelf. After 6 cuts, done! I thought I did something wrong?! Nope! Crap blade that Lowe's needs to get off their shelves and refund people there wasted money. Too bad they couldn't pay me for my wasted time. Do not waste your money on this unless you enjoy cursing, being frustrated and wasting time/money!!!!
reviews.author: Disappointed

reviews.title: "Doesn't hold up well against fibercement"
reviews.text: I purchased one of these blades as they were less expensive than the competitor.  I used it to make cuts on Hardie panels.  It started out working well and cut straight, but by the time I had made several cuts totaling about 18 feet, the blade was shot and just smoked while trying to cut.  As this was my first time cutting fibercement panels with a specialized blade, I can't recommend anything better, but this blade would be costly for a large project.
reviews.author: Tranquility

reviews.title: "This blade is trash"
reviews.text: 15 cuts I was able to do... FIFTEEN CUTS...
reviews.author: Alex

reviews.text: Cutting tips wore out very quickly.
reviews.author: Duke

reviews.title: "Poor blade"
reviews.text: Irwin need to stop selling this blade. I wish I had read these reviews before buying. First blade did a couple of small walls over a porch. Second blade got about 10 cuts before it was done.
reviews.author: charlie

reviews.title: "So bad"
reviews.text: Do not buy this blade.  Cut maybe 60" of hardi backer and the blade starts emitting sparks. The carbide teeth - all 6 were gone. Such a shame the Irwin puts this on the market.
reviews.author: Trans4ma

reviews.title: "wasted of money...."
reviews.text: Only about 15 cuts and it was done. I went back to my old blade and still cutting it now, after 20 cuts. Dont waste the money, not recommended.
reviews.author: LC

reviews.title: "dulled very quickly"
reviews.text: same result as above.  4 cross cuts on fiber cement lap siding, then it was dull and burned up. must be bad lot with manufactures defect.
reviews.author: WDB

reviews.title: "Don't waste your money"
reviews.text: Don't waist your money on this saw blade.  I made less than 20 cuts and the blade was no longer usable.
reviews.author: Kent

reviews.title: "Terrible Blade!!"
reviews.text: Became dull and started smoking after cutting 6 linear feet of James Hardie 4x8 5/8 panel, ended up using a jigsaw with a wood blade, heard that a diablo blade or shears is the way to go. Do not buy this! Total waste of time.
reviews.author: H

reviews.title: "Trash"
reviews.text: Wasted my mone and made one cut before the blade was completely unusable. I was cutting a 4x8 sheet of Hardie bd 3/8 inch thick. Just buy a different blade and save your self another trip to the store.
reviews.author: Greg

reviews.title: "Horrible"
reviews.text: Ripped 6' of one piece of fiber siding. Teeth came off and blade started glowing red hot. I couldn't believe the horrible reviews were accurate. But they are.
reviews.author: Scott28348

reviews.text: There is no review to accompany this rating.
reviews.author: Waz

reviews.title: "Please pull this product for your shelves"
reviews.text: This is the only review I have ever written for Lowes.  I am a contractor and just grabbed 2 of these blades today as I finally wore out another brand of blade that I have use extensively.  They were dead in 6 rip cuts each in hardie, I counted.  I was not able to complete my work today as a result which as a business man is less than ideal.  This is hardly the fault of Lowes where I shop almost daily. However Lowes does not need to leave this product on their shelves and there are many other choices available at this price point to fill the lowes shelves.  Some of us literally depend on lowes to provide quality products by which we run our businesses.  I would like to propose the following, contact Irwin and have them provide an RMA for this product and compensate lowes for damage to your brand. While your on the phone to Irwin I would ask the engineering manager for a copy of their test results when this product was developed.  If they are looking for a place to test there product they are welcome to join me for a month, send them my contact information if you like.  We can go out together and try to make a living using this product.  I am willing to bet once their kids start to get hungry their testing will improve.  Better yet Lowes can send them a stick of hardie for Irwin to actually make 6 cuts with, that will be a great start to their new and improved testing.
reviews.author: Jeffrey

reviews.title: "Short Lived"
reviews.text: This is an expensive blade and there is a better way to go. My blade dulled much too quickly. In doing so, it started a vibration that ruined any chances at accurate cuts. My advice is to take a regular carbide tipped construction blade that has dulled and use it instead. A little more dust is generated, but the blade will get it done and save a lot of money.
reviews.author: Dissapointed

reviews.title: "WISH I HAD READ THE REVIEWS FIRST"
reviews.text: Bought this for Hardie Siding and trim, which I bought at Lowe's at the same time for a small siding repair...lasted 4 cuts then was so dull it started smoking and bogging down.  It got so hot that the blade looked like it was warped.  Went back to Lowe's and got the $50 Dewalt blade; well worth the money.  They shouldn't be selling this.
reviews.author: trod

reviews.title: "Does not last long"
reviews.text: Currently putting on Hardie board fiber cement siding, and this is the only blade that Lowe's carries for this. These blades will only last a few cuts on these boards. After a handful of cuts, they start to bind and warp causing the blade to burn rather than cut through. I've been through maybe 50 blades on this project because of this.
reviews.author: CGentry

reviews.title: "Only for a small repair job"
reviews.text: For $20 I was willing to use it on the small repair job on my house. It did provide one good 4 Ft cut to fit the board under the window.  I made the mistake of using the saw for the trimming the boards to length instead of scoring and breaking the boards 12 times. The blade the failed in the middle of the next 4 Ft cut. Plan accordingly
reviews.author: Bob

reviews.title: "Doesn't cut hardi siding"
reviews.text: Can't believe they sell this thing! Doesn't cut hardi at all! They need to remove this from the shelves. I bought 2 of them and couldn't cut more than a few pieces. Not only was it a wast of money, it was a huge wast of my time.
reviews.author: Dave

reviews.title: "the title should have" fiber cement blade" in it."
reviews.text: The blade cuts as expected , good pricing value ! I like the blue color as opposed to yellow, which clashes with my grey saw. LOL makes me feel better when I do not look like a homeowner DIY'er after 45 yrs experience.
reviews.author: Dean

reviews.title: "Irwin Fiber Cement Blade"
reviews.text: Made a mistake of not reading reviews before buying this blade. Like everyone else has said, this blade is an utter and complete piece of garbage. Becomes dull after very few uses.
reviews.author: Brayton

reviews.title: "junk"
reviews.text: This saw blade says its spicificly for concrete siding I litrally made 10 cuts with it and it was completly useless I should have just put the money towards a diamond blade.
reviews.author: josh

reviews.title: "No good for Hardie"
reviews.text: Bought 3 blades for my project.  The last one burnt after 4 cuts.  I'm not sure what kind of fiber cement this is intended for...‚Ä¶. definitely doesn't work for Hardie.
reviews.author: redleg

reviews.title: "Perfect For a Handymandy"
reviews.text: Perfect for a Handy-Mandy that may need just 1 Cut off a Siding Board. This is Definitely not for Pros like myself. I will stick with GripRite or Diablo Blade.
reviews.author: NotaHandy-Mandy

reviews.title: "Like cutting through butter."
reviews.text: This odd looking blade did a great job cutting cementatious siding on my project.  Great price.  Makes a lot of dust, but that is the nature of this siding.
reviews.author: Stingray

reviews.text: I used it to cut through Durock tile underpayment. Blade cut through the Durock with no problems. I made numerous cuts and blade remained sharp.
reviews.author: Tom

reviews.title: "Waste of money"
reviews.text: Didnt last 20 cuts on hardee sidin doin just cross cuts, didnt even make it so i could use it on a rip
reviews.author: Steve

reviews.title: "Remodeling kitchen"
reviews.text: Bought this to cut the backer board for our backsplash. It was the right blade for the job!
reviews.author: BigDave

reviews.title: "Bought to Cut a Cement Board; and it Did"
reviews.text: Needed this particular blade for cutting a cement board. It did as I hoped. No complaints.
reviews.author: Richard

reviews.text: this is junk save your money I should have read the Reviews I wouldn't even give it a one
reviews.author: mike

reviews.title: "Throwing your money"
reviews.text: Don't waste your money on it, buy a regular framing blade and it will last u more cuts
reviews.author: Ngs

reviews.title: "tike work"
reviews.text: used to cut Hardi Backer 1/2 inch did not last long. Maybe better for 1/4 inch
reviews.author: Roger

reviews.title: "It's a saw blade!"
reviews.text: Works much better than the dull one I took off!We'll see how long it last!!!
reviews.author: Rayzor

reviews.title: "No better cut"
reviews.text: This blade cuts cement backer board no better than a good carbide tip blade.
reviews.author: James

reviews.title: "cut to the chase"
reviews.text: trying to firm my floor needed this blade to cut the cement board
reviews.author: ncdave

reviews.title: "Junk"
reviews.text: Don't waste your 20 bucks Doesn't last 2 hours of cutting
reviews.author: FloridaSolarCooperative

reviews.title: "Very bad zero stars really."
reviews.text: Same experience as others.  5 cuts and dull/done.
reviews.author: Cybeth

reviews.title: "Great for a play house"
reviews.text: Work Great on cutting  for a play house
reviews.author: Dave

reviews.title: "smooth cut"
reviews.text: works supper find
reviews.author: butch

reviews.text: There is no review to accompany this rating.
reviews.author: Mjndrsn1

reviews.text: There is no review to accompany this rating.
reviews.author: Joe

reviews.text: There is no review to accompany this rating.
reviews.author: J

reviews.text: There is no review to accompany this rating.
reviews.author: Pops

reviews.text: There is no review to accompany this rating.
reviews.author: TPugh

reviews.text: There is no review to accompany this rating.
reviews.author: Wes

reviews.text: There is no review to accompany this rating.
reviews.author: Bronson

questions.question: "How can Lowes and Irwin sell this blade for cutting fiber cement. It's completely worthless and does not properly cut fiber cement boards. See reviews"
questions.author: Anonymous

answers.author: SBD_Product Expert
answers.text: If you should have any issues with this product, please contact IRWIN at wecare@sbdinc.com so we may best assist you.
